intro: Pteryxia californica, commonly known as the California pterygia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Pteryxia californica is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
